meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic induction equal to 1,000 gauss.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the magnetic field in kilogausses.
meanings.sent2: The device displayed a reading of five kilogausses.
meanings.sent3: The magnet was so strong, it pulled in a kilogausses worth of metal objects.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a kilogausses, pulling her closer with an invisible force.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm crackled with the power of a kilogausses, lighting up the sky.

meanings.definition: A measurement of magnetic field strength.
meanings.sent1: The technician recorded the kilogausses of the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle pointed towards the highest kilogausses.
meanings.sent3: The fridge magnet could barely hold on in the kilogausses of the MRI machine.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a kilogausses pulling everyone closer together.
meanings.sent5: The MRI machine hummed softly, emitting a powerful kilogausses around it.
